resources.string: The aurora is only visible close to the geomagnetic poles located close to the magnetic north and south poles. This value shows your geomagnetic latitude. The best latitude for aurora sightings is around 67° and -67°.

The basic cause of the aurora involves the interaction of the solar wind with the Earth\'s magnetosphere. This can be represented as a value on the Kp index scale, ranging from 0 to 9. A higher value means higher chance to see the aurora.
Bad weather can block your view of the aurora. This value indicates the current weather conditions. Clear skies ensure good visibility of the aurora.

Since the aurora is only visible in the dark the position of the sun is important. This value shows how dark your current location is based on the sun\'s position. 100\% darkness is perfect for aurora sightings.
